ref: 9893 márman n. ʻ vulnerable spot, vital organ ʼ RV., ʻ secret ʼ Nāgeś., ʻ limb, joint ʼ lex. [Prob. IE. *mel -- ʻ be soft ʼ (EWA ii 596) in mr̥dú -- &c. Semant. (ʻ soft spot > joint ʼ) cf. Psht. maṛwand ʻ wrist ʼ < *mr̥du -- banda<-> EVP 47 (J. C. W.)]
Pa. mamma -- n. ʻ vital spot, soft spot in body, joint ʼ;
Pk. mamma -- m.n. ʻ vital spot ʼ;
H. mām m. ʻ secret quality, latent power, resources ʼ. --
B. māmṛi ʻ scab on healing sore ʼ (ODBL 691) < *mammaḍa -- .
